content:
Chicago has a diverse culinary scene with many hidden gems. Here are 20 lesser-known places to get food in Chicago:

1. The Publican: This West Loop spot serves up a variety of pork-centric dishes, including house-made charcuterie and wood-fired meats.
2. Mi Tocaya Antojeria: This Logan Square spot serves up a variety of authentic Mexican dishes, including ceviche, tamales, and mole.
3. Kimski: This Bridgeport spot serves up a variety of Korean-Polish fusion dishes, including kimchi pierogi and Korean fried chicken.
4. The Winchester: This Ukranian Village spot serves up a variety of comfort food dishes, including mac and cheese, fried chicken, and meatloaf.
5. L'Patron: This Pilsen spot serves up a variety of authentic Mexican street food, including tacos, tortas, and tamales.
6. Cellar Door Provisions: This West Town spot serves up a variety of sandwiches, charcuterie, and pickles, using locally-sourced ingredients.
7. Pacific Standard Time: This River North spot serves up a variety of seafood-focused dishes, including raw bar options and poke bowls.
8. The Angry Crab: This Bridgeport spot serves up a variety of seafood boils, including crab, shrimp, and crawfish.
9. The Duck Inn: This Bridgeport spot serves up a variety of comfort food dishes, including duck confit and foie gras poutine.
10. The Jibarito Stop: This Humboldt Park spot serves up a variety of Puerto Rican-style sandwiches, including the famous Jibarito sandwich.
11. The Budlong: This Lincoln Square
